title: Bell of Opening
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening/ko "Bell of Opening/ko")

| ( [![Bell of Opening.png](/images/5/54/Bell_of_Opening.png)](/wiki/File:Bell_of_Opening.png) |                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                         | Bell of Opening                    |
| Appearance                                                                                   | silver bell                        |
| Base price                                                                                   | 5000 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") |
| Weight                                                                                       | [10](/wiki/Weight "Weight")        |
| Material                                                                                     | [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver")    |
| Monster use                                                                                  | *Will not be used by monsters.*    |

The **Bell of Opening** is one of the [unique items](/wiki/Unique_items "Unique items") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is guarded by your [role](/wiki/Role "Role")'s [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis") along with the role [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), and is needed for the [invocation ritual](/wiki/Invocation_ritual "Invocation ritual") in order to access [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum"). It is made of [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") and appears as a **silver bell** when unidentified.

Like all Invocation items, the Bell of Opening cannot be put into a [container](/wiki/Container "Container") and is impossible to destroy.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Origin](#Origin)
- [6 Variants](#Variants)
  - [6.1 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
- [7 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

The Bell of Opening will always be placed in the inventory of the quest nemesis once [you](/wiki/You "You") enter the goal level of your [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) The Bell always starts with three charges and can hold a maximum of five charges, and can also be recharged indefinitely.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Description

Applying a charged, non-cursed Bell of Opening will detect secret doors, [magic portals](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") and [traps](/wiki/Trap "Trap") in your sight within a radius of 8 squares like a [wand of secret door detection](/wiki/Wand_of_secret_door_detection "Wand of secret door detection");[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) it will also cause you to be spit out if engulfed, like a [wand of opening](/wiki/Wand_of_opening "Wand of opening").[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) If blessed, the Bell will additionally open nearby objects and dungeon features such as [doors](/wiki/Door "Door"), [chests](/wiki/Chest "Chest"), and [drawbridges](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge") within the same radius.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)[\[8\]](#cite_note-8) If cursed, the Bell will instead wake nearby monsters and raise the dead similar to the [Book of the Dead](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead "Book of the Dead"), but without reviving corpses.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9) When applied with no charges, it acts as a normal [bell](/wiki/Bell "Bell").

Applying the non-cursed Bell with charges while not engulfed or else applying it during the Invocation while uncharged will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") it.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)

## Strategy

As part of the Invocation, the non-cursed and charged Bell of Opening must be applied second, after you light the non-cursed [Candelabrum of Invocation](/wiki/Candelabrum_of_Invocation "Candelabrum of Invocation") with 7 candles placed in it.

Outside of the Invocation, the Bell of Opening can also double as a silver weapon for the [shade](/wiki/Shade "Shade")-infested [Orcus Town](/wiki/Orcus_Town "Orcus Town"), and may be of particular use to a [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk") preserving their [weaponless](/wiki/Weaponless "Weaponless") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct"). The Bell can also be used to find the secret door along the temple wall in Moloch's Sanctum.

## History

The Bell of Opening and the other invocation items first appear in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Bell, book, and candle](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bell,_book,_and_candle "wikipedia:Bell, book, and candle")***

The motif of "Bell, Book and Candle" originated as a Catholic ritual of excommunication by anathema, although in some works it is often portrayed in connection with exorcism (e.g., the Terry Pratchett/Neil Gaiman novel *Good Omens*). One notable occurrence of the motif is in the 1985 computer role playing game *Ultima IV: Quest of the Avatar*: the player must find the Bell of Courage, the Book of Truth, and the Candle of Love in order to enter the Abyss, the final dungeon of the game.

The Bell of Opening is the only invocation ritual item that does not use an analogue from another folkloric source in addition.

## Variants

In variants with [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials") systems, the Bell of Opening may appear as an **engraved silver bell** instead.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the Bell of Opening cannot be used properly for the invocation until the hero completes their quest, and will be marked as "(locked)" to denote this - the Bell of Opening will unlock once the quest leader is spoken to after the hero retrieves the quest artifact, or else once the quest leader is killed.

## Encyclopedia entry

"A bell, book and candle job."  
The Bursar sighed. "We tried that, Archchancellor."  
The Archchancellor leaned towards him.  
"Eh?" he said.  
"I \_said\_, we tried that Archchancellor," said the Bursar loudly,  
directing his voice at the old man's ear. "After dinner, you  
remember? We used Humptemper's \_Names of the Ants\_ and rang Old  
Tom."\*  
"Did we, indeed. Worked, did it?"  
"\_No\_, Archchancellor."  
   
\* Old Tom was the single cracked bronze bell in the University  
bell tower.

\[ Eric, by Terry Pratchett ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1310](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L1310)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 586](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L586)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 955](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mkobj.c#L955)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1124](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/apply.c#L1124)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1069](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/apply.c#L1069)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1105](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/apply.c#L1105)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/detect.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1584](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/detect.c#L1584)
8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) [src/detect.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1510](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/detect.c#L1510)
9. [↑](#cite_ref-9) [src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1080](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/apply.c#L1080)
10. [↑](#cite_ref-10) [src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1132](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/apply.c#L1132)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Bell of Opening

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

(
Name Bell of Opening
Appearance silver bell
Base price 5000 zm
Weight 10
Material silver
Monster use Will not be used by monsters.

The Bell of Opening is one of the unique items that appears in NetHack. It is guarded by your role's quest nemesis along with the role quest artifact, and is needed for the invocation ritual in order to access Moloch's Sanctum. It is made of silver and appears as a silver bell when unidentified.

Like all Invocation items, the Bell of Opening cannot be put into a container and is impossible to destroy.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Origin
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 EvilHack
  • 7 Encyclopedia entry
  • 8 References

Generation

The Bell of Opening will always be placed in the inventory of the quest nemesis once you enter the goal level of your Quest.[1] The Bell always starts with three charges and can hold a maximum of five charges, and can also be recharged indefinitely.[2][3]

Description

Applying a charged, non-cursed Bell of Opening will detect secret doors, magic portals and traps in your sight within a radius of 8 squares like a wand of secret door detection;[4] it will also cause you to be spit out if engulfed, like a wand of opening.[5] If blessed, the Bell will additionally open nearby objects and dungeon features such as doors, chests, and drawbridges within the same radius.[6][7][8] If cursed, the Bell will instead wake nearby monsters and raise the dead similar to the Book of the Dead, but without reviving corpses.[9] When applied with no charges, it acts as a normal bell.

Applying the non-cursed Bell with charges while not engulfed or else applying it during the Invocation while uncharged will auto-identify it.[10]

Strategy

As part of the Invocation, the non-cursed and charged Bell of Opening must be applied second, after you light the non-cursed Candelabrum of Invocation with 7 candles placed in it.

Outside of the Invocation, the Bell of Opening can also double as a silver weapon for the shade-infested Orcus Town, and may be of particular use to a Monk preserving their weaponless conduct. The Bell can also be used to find the secret door along the temple wall in Moloch's Sanctum.

History

The Bell of Opening and the other invocation items first appear in NetHack 3.1.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Bell, book, and candle

The motif of "Bell, Book and Candle" originated as a Catholic ritual of excommunication by anathema, although in some works it is often portrayed in connection with exorcism (e.g., the Terry Pratchett/Neil Gaiman novel Good Omens). One notable occurrence of the motif is in the 1985 computer role playing game Ultima IV: Quest of the Avatar: the player must find the Bell of Courage, the Book of Truth, and the Candle of Love in order to enter the Abyss, the final dungeon of the game.

The Bell of Opening is the only invocation ritual item that does not use an analogue from another folkloric source in addition.

Variants

In variants with object materials systems, the Bell of Opening may appear as an engraved silver bell instead.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, the Bell of Opening cannot be used properly for the invocation until the hero completes their quest, and will be marked as "(locked)" to denote this - the Bell of Opening will unlock once the quest leader is spoken to after the hero retrieves the quest artifact, or else once the quest leader is killed.

Encyclopedia entry

"A bell, book and candle job."
The Bursar sighed. "We tried that, Archchancellor."
The Archchancellor leaned towards him.
"Eh?" he said.
"I _said_, we tried that Archchancellor," said the Bursar loudly,
directing his voice at the old man's ear. "After dinner, you
remember? We used Humptemper's _Names of the Ants_ and rang Old
Tom."*
"Did we, indeed. Worked, did it?"
"_No_, Archchancellor."
 
* Old Tom was the single cracked bronze bell in the University
bell tower.

[ Eric, by Terry Pratchett ]

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1310
  2. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 586
  3. ↑ src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 955
  4. ↑ src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1124
  5. ↑ src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1069
  6. ↑ src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1105
  7. ↑ src/detect.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1584
  8. ↑ src/detect.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1510
  9. ↑ src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1080
  10. ↑ src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1132

The '''Bell of Opening''' is one of the [[unique items]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is guarded by your [[role]]'s [[quest nemesis]] along with the role [[quest artifact]], and is needed for the [[invocation ritual]] in order to access [[Moloch's Sanctum]]. It is made of [[silver]] and appears as a '''silver bell''' when unidentified.

Like all Invocation items, the Bell of Opening cannot be put into a [[container]] and is impossible to destroy.

==Generation==
The Bell of Opening will always be placed in the inventory of the quest nemesis once [[you]] enter the goal level of your [[Quest]].{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1310|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} The Bell always starts with three charges and can hold a maximum of five charges, and can also be recharged indefinitely.{{refsrc|src/read.c|586|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/mkobj.c|955|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Description==
Applying a charged, non-cursed Bell of Opening will detect secret doors, [[magic portal]]s and [[trap]]s in your sight within a radius of 8 squares like a [[wand of secret door detection]];{{refsrc|src/apply.c|1124|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} it will also cause you to be spit out if engulfed, like a [[wand of opening]].{{refsrc|src/apply.c|1069|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} If blessed, the Bell will additionally open nearby objects and dungeon features such as [[door]]s, [[chest]]s, and [[drawbridge]]s within the same radius.{{refsrc|src/apply.c|1105|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/detect.c|1584|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/detect.c|1510|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} If cursed, the Bell will instead wake nearby monsters and raise the dead similar to the [[Book of the Dead]], but without reviving corpses.{{refsrc|src/apply.c|1080|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} When applied with no charges, it acts as a normal [[bell]].

Applying the non-cursed Bell with charges while not engulfed or else applying it during the Invocation while uncharged will [[auto-identify]] it.{{refsrc|src/apply.c|1132|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Strategy==
As part of the Invocation, the non-cursed and charged Bell of Opening must be applied second, after you light the non-cursed [[Candelabrum of Invocation]] with 7 candles placed in it.

Outside of the Invocation, the Bell of Opening can also double as a silver weapon for the [[shade]]-infested [[Orcus Town]], and may be of particular use to a [[Monk]] preserving their [[weaponless]] [[conduct]]. The Bell can also be used to find the secret door along the temple wall in Moloch's Sanctum.

==History==
The Bell of Opening and the other invocation items first appear in [[NetHack 3.1.0]].

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Bell, book, and candle}}
The motif of "Bell, Book and Candle" originated as a Catholic ritual of excommunication by anathema, although in some works it is often portrayed in connection with exorcism (e.g., the Terry Pratchett/Neil Gaiman novel ''Good Omens''). One notable occurrence of the motif is in the 1985 computer role playing game ''Ultima IV: Quest of the Avatar'': the player must find the Bell of Courage, the Book of Truth, and the Candle of Love in order to enter the Abyss, the final dungeon of the game.

The Bell of Opening is the only invocation ritual item that does not use an analogue from another folkloric source in addition.

==Variants==
In variants with [[object materials]] systems, the Bell of Opening may appear as an '''engraved silver bell''' instead.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], the Bell of Opening cannot be used properly for the invocation until the hero completes their quest, and will be marked as "(locked)" to denote this - the Bell of Opening will unlock once the quest leader is spoken to after the hero retrieves the quest artifact, or else once the quest leader is killed.

==Encyclopedia entry==

"A bell, book and candle job."
The Bursar sighed.  "We tried that, Archchancellor."
The Archchancellor leaned towards him.
"Eh?" he said.
"I _said_, we tried that Archchancellor," said the Bursar loudly,
directing his voice at the old man's ear.  "After dinner, you
remember?  We used Humptemper's _Names of the Ants_ and rang Old
Tom."*
"Did we, indeed.  Worked, did it?"
"_No_, Archchancellor."
 
<nowiki>*</nowiki> Old Tom was the single cracked bronze bell in the University
bell tower.
|[ Eric, by Terry Pratchett ]
